meanings.definition: The number of live births per 1,000 of a population per year.
meanings.sent1: The birthrate in the village increased significantly last year.
meanings.sent2: The birthrate in the city has been steadily declining over the past decade.
meanings.sent3: The birthrate in the zoo was so high that the storks were working overtime!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like a high birthrate in a bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The birthrate of the flowers in the garden was a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The rate at which births occur in a particular area or population.
meanings.sent1: The birthrate of the neighborhood has been a topic of discussion lately.
meanings.sent2: The birthrate of the country is a key factor in its future development.
meanings.sent3: The birthrate of the puppies in the shelter was overwhelming but heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: His ideas flowed out of him at a high birthrate, leaving everyone amazed.
meanings.sent5: The birthrate of ideas in the brainstorming session was inspiring and energizing.
